intro: Chorizanthe uniaristata, commonly known as the single-armed cholla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, branching stems that are covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Chorizanthe uniaristata is well adapted to drought conditions and is an important plant in desert ecosystems.
